body.p: Noticed “,” at the east end of westernmost Andromeda Pond “,” the slender spikes of lycopus with half a dozen distant little spherical dark-brown whorls of pungently fragrant or spicy seeds “,” somewhat nutmeg-like “,” or even like flagroot “,” when bruised. I am not sure that the seeds of any other mint are thus fragrant now. It scents your handkerchief or pocketbook finely when the crumbled whorls are sprinkled over them.”
PE 11, pg. 196-197 / 7 September 1856-1 April 1857/ NNPM MA 1302:28 / T vol. # XXII / PDF # XV / JIX
